snippet: A bombing that killed at least 71 people in the capital may indicate that the extremist group Boko Haram is stepping up efforts to destabilize state institutions.
abstract: Militants bomb a bus station in Abuja, Nigeria, in one of the worst attacks in years in the country's struggle with insurgents; at least 71 people are killed; officials immediately attribute bombing to Islamist group Boko Haram.

byline.contributor: Musikilu Mojeed contributed reporting from Abuja, Nigeria.

lead_paragraph: A bombing that killed at least 71 people in the capital may indicate that the extremist group Boko Haram is stepping up efforts to destabilize state institutions.

headline.main: Nigeria Blast Kills Dozens as Militants Hit Capital
headline.print_headline: Nigeria Blast Kills Dozens as Militants Hit Capital
